reviews.review_msg: I don't care how terrible he is. Average is an A. BTW I will take his 460

People are giving him harsh words, I like him a lot! Notes in class he walks through step by step but sometimes not necessary, the problem sets are difficult but they make you think about it. Plus you can ask him anything in office hours and he will help! The midterms are not bad if you practice from previous exams from the previous years he posts.

This has to be one of the most pointless classes ever. I couldn't stand attending class because it was ridiculously boring and borderline useless. He uses the exact same tests and assignements. His marking is completely ridiculous - even if you directly copy and assignment from a previous semester you will not get 100%. Same with tests.Awfull class

Boring prof, boring lectures, and a boring class overall. CHEM360 is by far the most useless course a chem major ever needed. No need to go to class because he just rewrites notes that are posted on his website. Just look at his old exams posted on his web bc he refuses them. For hw, just get a friend who took the course and ask for the sltn.

Wilkie has his good and bad sides. He's good because he is very helpful in office hours, his midterms and final are based on his old ones, the first chem exam never had to stress over. Lecture wise he's ok but very boring. The notes are already on his webpg but always rewrites them, notes are detailed but doesn't help in work & nor tested on exams.

If you wanna do well in his class, make sure you attend lectures and office hours. He can have office hour as long as the students want. He is so helpful and will solve for you assignment problems step by step. Also, the assignments and exams are just from previous exams which are posted on his website. Overall, he is a great prof!

An ok prof. lec notes are on his personal websites to dl. kinda boring lectures and kinda shy too, very helpful when asking for help. just get a friend whose taken his course to safe the pdf of the hw solutions. look at old mts and finals because he resuses them=).

Notes are available for dl, and he rewrites them in lecture: awful speaker all-in-all. Exam questions are reused so study the practice mt's and finals. Tutorial notes are posted too but the TA provides hints in class. Prof marks VERY strictly and on the practice exams he varies what he gives marks for year to year, so be careful. Not the best prof.

Dr. Wilkie is a nice person and he does try to explain the material...but he just doesn't do a good job. Dull lectures and he stutters a lot. The TA was very helpful, though. Exams were based on his old exams but they're still marked very strictly (Dr. Wilkie marks them, not the TA).
Dr. Wilkie is not as bad as people say he is. Very nice and very helpful. Midterm and Final is based on his old exams. Do them and get a A+ =)

An overall nice prof, willing to help, though seems a bit nervous when helping. His final is straight off old exams, so study those well and of course the notes. Notes are detailed and lectures well given but could use more examples. Midterms had low avgs because his marking is far too strict. Textbook is a good resource for assignments and exams.
Not a bad prof like people say=)

lectures are straight forward and logical. Yes, he makes mistakes, but guys dont make fun of him! He seems really nervous and its hard to get what he's saying because of it. I think he really knows his stuff and he is very helpful. Assmts are really hard, but exams are really easy. Overall he does a fab job with dull material.

The man's marking is too strict and rather illogical.
 
 The man teaches without any heart, he is not a teacher, he is purely and absolutely a lecturer.
 
 Notes are detailed and not incomprehensible.
Makes a tough course tolerable. Decent notes, but too much detail at times. Look at the old exams. All the questions are re used.

Dr. Wilkie teaches at a good pace and his notes are quite thorough. He doesn't interact much with the class but he gets the ideas across reasonably well. A good fair prof. Homework assignments due every two weeks and are fairly straight forward.

Really good lecture notes although sometimes more detailed than necessary.  Tutorials good for practice questions.  TIP: Study the old exams and finals and you'll do well (exams were always very similar to the old ones).
made one too many mistakes in class and was pretty boring BUT makes a subject from hell MUCH easier than it can be. if you like passing and/or high grades, DEFINITELY MUST TAKE 360 with Wilkie!

He is not a bad person.  But he is very BORING.  He should definitely work on his sense of humor...at least it will not be a torture for morining classes.  I think he should lighten up a bit in lecture...instead of talking in monotone all the time.
great prof..gives lots of examples...available for help...take it with him, you wont regret it
take his class please. he is the best prof in this world
he is great~!
excellent prof
